abstract: Chinese judge surprises lawyers at hearing for human rights activist Yang Maodong, who also goes by pen name Guo Feixiong, by adding additional charge to previous conviction for disturbing public order, bringing his total sentence up to six years.
lead_paragraph: The addition of new charge, “picking quarrels and provoking trouble,” means that he will spend an additional two years in prison, according to his lawyers.

headline.main: Chinese Rights Advocate Known as Guo Feixiong Convicted of Unexpected New Charge
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; China: Second Charge, Conviction and 6-Year Sentence, All at Once

snippet: The addition of new charge, “picking quarrels and provoking trouble,” means that he will spend an additional two years in prison, according to his lawyers.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
